![](images/R_logo.svg.png){width="300"}

# work with file

## get current directory

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
getwd()
```
:::

## get all file name under current directory

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
list.files()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "1 basic R.qmd"                 "1 basic R.rmarkdown"          
 [3] "1-basic-R.rmarkdown"           "2 probability.qmd"            
 [5] "3 Statistics.qmd"              "5 R boook.qmd"                
 [7] "6 data analytic in R book.qmd" "7 error handling.html"        
 [9] "7 error handling.qmd"          "hotels.csv"                   
[11] "images"                       
```


:::
:::

## get all file name under currrents parent directory

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
list.files("../")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "_freeze"               "_publish.yml"          "_quarto.yml"          
 [4] "_site"                 "data manipulation"     "docs"                 
 [7] "foldableCodeBlcok.lua" "images"                "index.qmd"            
[10] "intro"                 "logo.jpg"              "other"                
[13] "Plot"                  "Publish"               "Rlogo.png"            
[16] "sidebar.png"           "site_libs"             "styles.css"           
[19] "tidymodeling.Rproj"   
```


:::
:::


## get file info

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
file.info("6 data analytic in R book.qmd")
```
:::

## create folder

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dir.create('testing_folder')
```
:::

## delete folder/file

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
file.remove('testing_folder')
```
:::

## copy file

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(fs)
file_copy('test.csv', 'test2.csv')
```
:::

## download file from internet

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-02-11/hotels.csv"

download.file(url = url, destfile = "hotels.csv")
```
:::


## download table from internet

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
library(janitor)

nba_wiki_url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_NBA_champions'
  
nba_wiki_data001=nba_wiki_url %>% read_html() %>% html_table()

nba_wiki_data002=nba_wiki_data001[[2]] %>% clean_names()

nba_wiki_data003=nba_wiki_data002 %>%filter(!row_number() %in% c(1, 5)) %>% mutate(year=str_sub(year, 1, 4))

tail(nba_wiki_data003)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 6 × 8
  year  western_champion      coach result eastern_champion coach_2 finals_mvp_a
  <chr> <chr>                 <chr> <chr>  <chr>            <chr>   <chr>       
1 2019  Golden State Warrior… Stev… 2–4    Toronto Raptors… Nick N… Kawhi Leona…
2 2020  Los Angeles Lakers (… Fran… 4–2    Miami Heat (5) … Erik S… LeBron James
3 2021  Phoenix Suns (2) (3,… Mont… 2–4    Milwaukee Bucks… Mike B… Giannis Ant…
4 2022  Golden State Warrior… Stev… 4–2    Boston Celtics … Ime Ud… Stephen Cur…
5 2023  Denver Nuggets (1) (… Mich… 4–1    Miami Heat (8) … Erik S… Nikola Jokić
6 2024  Dallas Mavericks (5)… Jaso… 1–4    Boston Celtics … Joe Ma… Jaylen Brown
# ℹ 1 more variable:
#   mw_parser_output_tooltip_dotted_border_bottom_1px_dotted_cursor_help_ref <chr>
```


:::
:::

# handle error

using tryCatch to continues the code chunk.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tryCatch({
  1+who
},error=function(e){
  message(paste0('Here is some error:',e))
})

print('end of the code chunk')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "end of the code chunk"
```


:::
:::



# Condition with if/elif/else

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- -5
if(x > 10){
print("Non-negative number and better than 10")
} else if (x > 0) {
  print("Non-negative number and better than 0")
} else {
print("Negative number")
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Negative number"
```


:::
:::



# Loop

## for Loop

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
for (x in 1:4) {
  print(x)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
```


:::
:::


with break statement

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
for (x in 1:6) {
  if (x == 4) {break}
  print(x)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
```


:::
:::
with next statement

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
for (x in 1:6) {
  if (x == 4) {next}
  print(x)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 5
[1] 6
```


:::
:::

## Error handling on for Loop:print out error

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
stuff <- list(12, 9, 2, "cat", 25, 10, "bird")
#stuff
```
:::


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
loop_num=0

for (i in 1:6) {
  loop_num=loop_num+1
  tryCatch (print(1+i),
           
           error = function(e){
           message(paste("An error occurred for loop num", loop_num,":\n"), e)
             
         })
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
[1] 5
[1] 6
[1] 7
```


:::
:::




## while Loop

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i <- 1
while (i < 6) {
  print(i)
  i <- i + 1
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
[1] 5
```


:::
:::

with break statement

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i <- 1
while (i < 6) {
  print(i)
  i <- i + 1
  if (i == 4) {break}
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
```


:::
:::

with next statement

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i =1

while (i < 6) {
  i <- i + 1
  if (i == 4){next}
  print(i)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 5
[1] 6
```


:::
:::



## Error handling on whie Loop: try when the error gone

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i=0
a=0
while (i < 4) {
  a=a+1
  print(i)
  tryCatch({
  asdfgaergae5gh5hae5h
    i=i+1
  },error = function(msg){print('eeeeeeee')
    i=i-1
    print(paste0("new i : ",i))
   
    })
   if(a>10){break}
  }
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
```


:::
:::




# function

## without Arguments

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
my_function <- function() { 
  print("Hello World!")
}

my_function()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Hello World!"
```


:::
:::

## with Arguments

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x) { 
  a=x+10
  return(a)
}

adding_ten(5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 15
```


:::
:::

## with default Arguments

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x=10) { 
  a=x+10
  return(a)
}

#if not define x, then x=10

adding_ten()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 20
```


:::
:::

## check function Arguments

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
args(adding_ten)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
function (x = 10) 
NULL
```


:::
:::

Many functions exhibit variadic behavior. That is, they can accept any num- ber of arguments, and it’s up to the user to decide how many arguments to provide. The functions c, data.frame, and list are all like this. When you call a function like data.frame, you can specify any number of members as arguments.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
args(data.frame)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
function (..., row.names = NULL, check.rows = FALSE, check.names = TRUE, 
    fix.empty.names = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) 
NULL
```


:::
:::

## warning in function

print out warning

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x=10) { 
  a=x+10
  if(a>50){
    warning('its better than 50')
  }
  return(a)
}
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten(100)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 110
```


:::
:::

## stop in function

print out stop error message

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x=10) { 
  a=x+10
  if(a>50){
    stop('its better than 50')
  }
  return(a)
}
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten(100)
```
:::

## use try to by pass error

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
try(adding_ten(100))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 110
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
5+10
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 15
```


:::
:::

# program running time

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
start_time=Sys.time()

v=matrix(1:100000000)
c=v*v

end_time=Sys.time()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
start_time
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "2025-02-17 15:55:06 CST"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
end_time
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "2025-02-17 15:55:07 CST"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
end_time-start_time
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Time difference of 0.4733481 secs
```


:::
:::

# Package

## check R version

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
version
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
               _                           
platform       aarch64-apple-darwin20      
arch           aarch64                     
os             darwin20                    
system         aarch64, darwin20           
status                                     
major          4                           
minor          4.1                         
year           2024                        
month          06                          
day            14                          
svn rev        86737                       
language       R                           
version.string R version 4.4.1 (2024-06-14)
nickname       Race for Your Life          
```


:::
:::

## install R package

### install from Cran

99% of the time will install pacakge from The Comprehensive R Archive Network(cran).<https://cran.r-project.org/>

![](images/1_wcX2tfGe4til0PmjxhKuQA.png){width="300"}

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages('tidyverse')
```
:::

### install from Github

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pak::pkg_install("tidymodels/learntidymodels")
```
:::

### install from .tar.gz

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/maptools/maptools_1.1-8.tar.gz")
```
:::

### install from Bioconductor

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pak::pkg_install("text2vec")
```
:::

### install from local

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pak::local_install("cli")
```
:::

## check one package version

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
packageVersion("tidyverse")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] '2.0.0'
```


:::
:::

tibble -> rlang
tibble -> vctrs -> lifecycle -> rlang
tibble -> vctrs -> rlang
```

remove.packages('xxxxx')
```

# sleep

The time interval to suspend execution for, in seconds.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Sys.sleep(3)
```
:::

# open two R session on Mac

::: {.cell filename='Terminal'}

```{.r .cell-code}
open -n /Applications/RStudio.app
```
:::


# Statistics



## Centrality: Mean, Median, Mode

## Spread: Variance, Standard Deviation, and the Interquartile Range

## Covariance and Correlation

When analyzing data, it’s often useful to be able to investigate the rela- tionship between two numeric variables to assess trends. For example, you might expect height and weight observations to have a noticeable positive relationship—taller people tend to weigh more. Conversely, you might imag- ine that handspan and length of hair would have less of an association. One of the simplest and most common ways such associations are quantified and compared is through the idea of correlation, for which you need the covariance. The covariance expresses how much two numeric variables “change together” and the nature of that relationship,

![](images/clipboard-4055345945.png)

## Correlation,Pearson’s product-moment correlation coefficient

Pearson’s sample correlation coef- ficient ρxy is computed by dividing the sample covariance by the product of the standard deviation of each data set

![](images/clipboard-1822919442.png)

Some Correlation Example:

![](images/clipboard-775702636.png)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sessionInfo()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

---
title: "Basic R"
author: "Tony Duan"

  warning: false

# work with file

## get current directory




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
getwd()
```
:::




## get all file name under current directory




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
list.files()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "1 basic R.qmd"                 "1 basic R.rmarkdown"          
 [3] "1-basic-R.rmarkdown"           "2 probability.qmd"            
 [5] "3 Statistics.qmd"              "5 R boook.qmd"                
 [7] "6 data analytic in R book.qmd" "7 error handling.qmd"         
 [9] "hotels.csv"                    "images"                       
```


:::
:::




## get all file name under currrents parent directory




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
list.files("../")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "_freeze"                      "_publish.yml"                
 [3] "_quarto.yml"                  "_site"                       
 [5] "clustering"                   "data manipulation"           
 [7] "docs"                         "foldableCodeBlcok.lua"       
 [9] "hotel classification model"   "house price regression model"
[11] "images"                       "index_files"                 
[13] "index.qmd"                    "intro"                       
[15] "logo.jpg"                     "model type"                  
[17] "Multiclass classification"    "other"                       
[19] "Plot"                         "styles.css"                  
[21] "tensorflow"                   "tidymodeling.Rproj"          
[23] "titanic classification model"
```


:::
:::





## get file info




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
file.info("6 data analytic in R book.qmd")
```
:::




## create folder




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dir.create('testing_folder')
```
:::




## delete folder/file




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
file.remove('testing_folder')
```
:::




## copy file




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(fs)
file_copy('test.csv', 'test2.csv')
```
:::




## download file from internet




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-02-11/hotels.csv"

download.file(url = url, destfile = "hotels.csv")
```
:::





## download table from internet




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
library(janitor)

nba_wiki_url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_NBA_champions'
  
nba_wiki_data001=nba_wiki_url %>% read_html() %>% html_table()

nba_wiki_data002=nba_wiki_data001[[2]] %>% clean_names()

nba_wiki_data003=nba_wiki_data002 %>%filter(!row_number() %in% c(1, 5)) %>% mutate(year=str_sub(year, 1, 4))

tail(nba_wiki_data003)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 6 × 8
  year  western_champion      coach result eastern_champion coach_2 finals_mvp_a
  <chr> <chr>                 <chr> <chr>  <chr>            <chr>   <chr>       
1 2019  Golden State Warrior… Stev… 2–4    Toronto Raptors… Nick N… Kawhi Leona…
2 2020  Los Angeles Lakers (… Fran… 4–2    Miami Heat (5) … Erik S… LeBron James
3 2021  Phoenix Suns (2) (3,… Mont… 2–4    Milwaukee Bucks… Mike B… Giannis Ant…
4 2022  Golden State Warrior… Stev… 4–2    Boston Celtics … Ime Ud… Stephen Cur…
5 2023  Denver Nuggets (1) (… Mich… 4–1    Miami Heat (8) … Erik S… Nikola Jokić
6 2024  Dallas Mavericks (5)… Jaso… 1–4    Boston Celtics … Joe Ma… Jaylen Brown
# ℹ 1 more variable:
#   mw_parser_output_tooltip_dotted_border_bottom_1px_dotted_cursor_help_ref <chr>
```


:::
:::




# handle error

using tryCatch to continues the code chunk.




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tryCatch({
  1+who
},error=function(e){
  message(paste0('Here is some error:',e))
})

print('end of the code chunk')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "end of the code chunk"
```


:::
:::






# Condition with if/elif/else




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- -5
if(x > 10){
print("Non-negative number and better than 10")
} else if (x > 0) {
  print("Non-negative number and better than 0")
} else {
print("Negative number")
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Negative number"
```


:::
:::






# Loop

## for Loop




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
for (x in 1:4) {
  print(x)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
```


:::
:::





with break statement




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
for (x in 1:6) {
  if (x == 4) {break}
  print(x)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
```


:::
:::



with next statement




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
for (x in 1:6) {
  if (x == 4) {next}
  print(x)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 5
[1] 6
```


:::
:::




## Error handling on for Loop:print out error




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
stuff <- list(12, 9, 2, "cat", 25, 10, "bird")
#stuff
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
loop_num=0

for (i in 1:6) {
  loop_num=loop_num+1
  tryCatch (print(1+i),
           
           error = function(e){
           message(paste("An error occurred for loop num", loop_num,":\n"), e)
             
         })
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
[1] 5
[1] 6
[1] 7
```


:::
:::







## while Loop




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i <- 1
while (i < 6) {
  print(i)
  i <- i + 1
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
[1] 5
```


:::
:::




with break statement




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i <- 1
while (i < 6) {
  print(i)
  i <- i + 1
  if (i == 4) {break}
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
```


:::
:::




with next statement




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i =1

while (i < 6) {
  i <- i + 1
  if (i == 4){next}
  print(i)
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 5
[1] 6
```


:::
:::






## Error handling on whie Loop: try when the error gone




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i=0
a=0
while (i < 4) {
  a=a+1
  print(i)
  tryCatch({
  asdfgaergae5gh5hae5h
    i=i+1
  },error = function(msg){print('eeeeeeee')
    i=i-1
    print(paste0("new i : ",i))
   
    })
   if(a>10){break}
  }
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
[1] 0
[1] "eeeeeeee"
[1] "new i : -1"
```


:::
:::







# function

## without Arguments




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
my_function <- function() { 
  print("Hello World!")
}

my_function()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Hello World!"
```


:::
:::




## with Arguments




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x) { 
  a=x+10
  return(a)
}

adding_ten(5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 15
```


:::
:::




## with default Arguments




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x=10) { 
  a=x+10
  return(a)
}

#if not define x, then x=10

adding_ten()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 20
```


:::
:::




## check function Arguments




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
args(adding_ten)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
function (x = 10) 
NULL
```


:::
:::




Many functions exhibit variadic behavior. That is, they can accept any num- ber of arguments, and it’s up to the user to decide how many arguments to provide. The functions c, data.frame, and list are all like this. When you call a function like data.frame, you can specify any number of members as arguments.




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
args(data.frame)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
function (..., row.names = NULL, check.rows = FALSE, check.names = TRUE, 
    fix.empty.names = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) 
NULL
```


:::
:::




## warning in function

print out warning




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x=10) { 
  a=x+10
  if(a>50){
    warning('its better than 50')
  }
  return(a)
}
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten(100)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 110
```


:::
:::




## stop in function

print out stop error message




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten <- function(x=10) { 
  a=x+10
  if(a>50){
    stop('its better than 50')
  }
  return(a)
}
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
adding_ten(100)
```
:::




## use try to by pass error




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
try(adding_ten(100))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 110
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
5+10
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 15
```


:::
:::




# program running time




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
start_time=Sys.time()

v=matrix(1:100000000)
c=v*v

end_time=Sys.time()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
start_time
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "2024-12-25 17:30:55 CST"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
end_time
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "2024-12-25 17:30:55 CST"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
end_time-start_time
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Time difference of 0.499712 secs
```


:::
:::

## install R package

### install from Cran

99% of the time will install pacakge from The Comprehensive R Archive Network(cran).<https://cran.r-project.org/>

![](images/1_wcX2tfGe4til0PmjxhKuQA.png){width="300"}




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages('tidyverse')
```
:::




### install from Github




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pak::pkg_install("tidymodels/learntidymodels")
```
:::




### install from .tar.gz




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/maptools/maptools_1.1-8.tar.gz")
```
:::




### install from Bioconductor




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pak::pkg_install("text2vec")
```
:::




### install from local




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pak::local_install("cli")
```
:::

# Statistics



## Centrality: Mean, Median, Mode

## Spread: Variance, Standard Deviation, and the Interquartile Range

## Covariance and Correlation

When analyzing data, it’s often useful to be able to investigate the rela- tionship between two numeric variables to assess trends. For example, you might expect height and weight observations to have a noticeable positive relationship—taller people tend to weigh more. Conversely, you might imag- ine that handspan and length of hair would have less of an association. One of the simplest and most common ways such associations are quantified and compared is through the idea of correlation, for which you need the covariance. The covariance expresses how much two numeric variables “change together” and the nature of that relationship,

![](images/clipboard-4055345945.png)

## Correlation,Pearson’s product-moment correlation coefficient

Pearson’s sample correlation coef- ficient ρxy is computed by dividing the sample covariance by the product of the standard deviation of each data set

![](images/clipboard-1822919442.png)

Some Correlation Example:

![](images/clipboard-775702636.png)






::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sessionInfo()
```
